data.title: Team Home National Trail Blazers Sports
data.meta_description: Follow the  Blazers schedule, roster, events and photos all in one place.
data.text:
Game Recap

The National Trail JV baseball team dropped their contest to Preble Shawnee on Saturday 15-4 in 5 innings.

Cole Yount took to the mound for the Blazers and was given the loss. He walked 5 and also struck out 5 in the contest.

Andrew Willett improved upon his OBP by reaching base 3 times on the day. Hunter Michael and Hunter Lee each had RBI singles on the day.

Game Recap

Hunter Lindsey drove in the go-ahead run to give National Trail the lead in the seventh inning, as the Blazers hung on to beat Seton Catholic 3-2 on Friday.

Angel Garabito doubled to get on base in the seventh. He then went from second to third on a sacrifice bunt by Chip Parker. Lindsey’s timely hit followed.

Billy Lanman’s 11 strikeouts helped National Trail as he earned the victory. Lanman allowed no earned runs on three hits and no walks over six innings.

Drake Wysong was charged with the loss for Seton. He lasted 6 1/3 innings, walked two, struck out four, and allowed three runs.

The bottom of the first saw Seton Catholic take an early lead, 2-0. A single by Pipenger, plating Cliff Dickman and Nick Mathews started the inning off.

National Trail’s Michael Bane came in for the 7th to get the final three outs to record the save.

The Blazers varsity baseball team will be back in action tomorrow in a doubleheader at home against county for, Preble Shawnee. First pitch is slated for 11 am.

Game Recap

Payten Laird had a solid day out on the mound against Miami East to get the win. She pitched a shut out allowing only 4 hits and striking out 7 with Alexus Acton behind the plate.

The blazers struggled to get runs in until the bottom of the 5 when Ariel Lee walked and stole a base, Payten Laird hit a double up the middle, and then Kylee Aldridge hit a triple to the opposite field scoring Lee and laird. Aldridge then scored on a passed ball.

Other hits: Payten Laird 2-3 with a 2B, Savannah Abner 2B, Kerestin Nugent 1B.

The Blazers improve their record to 10-4 and 4-3 in the CCC. Next game will be a double header on Saturday at Preble Shawnee.

Game Recap

Great effort by all for the win over Dayton Christian!

Elizabeth Glander was hanging on to a no hitter until the top of the 5th when Dayton Christian got their first hit of the game. Elizabeth struck out 9 and only allowed that one hit with Alexus Acton behind the plate.

The bats were hot all the way through the line up. Payten Laird went 2-3 with 2 RBIs. Kylee Aldridge went 2-2 with a triple, HR and 3 RBIs. Alexus Acton went 3-4 with a double, triple and 3 RBIs. Bobbi Grimes went 2-2 with a triple. Hannah Dixon went 2-2. Kayleight Minner and Savannah Abner added doubles. Aleah Hunt added a triple. Makayla Duffie, Kim Dennull, and Ariel Lee all added base hits.

The blazers improved their record to 9-4 and will host Miami East in a CCC matchup tomorrow!

Game Recap

The National Trail Blazers Varsity baseball team jumped out to an early lead on Dayton Christian and captured a 16-6 victory on Monday in 6 innings.

Seven runs in the first three innings allowed National Trail Blazers Varsity to put the game away early.

An RBI single by Travis Hunt, an RBI single by Dom Huffman, an error, and an RBI single by Michael Bane during the second inning supplied the early offense for the Blazers.

Chip Parker racked up two RBIs on three hits for National Trail. He singled in the second, third, and sixth innings.

Billy Lanman got it done on the bump on the way to a win. He allowed two runs over 3 1/3 innings. Lanman struck out two, walked none and gave up two hits.

Gibboney was the game’s losing pitcher. He allowed 13 runs in five innings, walked one and struck out six.

The National Trail Blazers added three more runs in the bottom of the third. Trey Mann scored for the inning’s first run. That was followed up by Parker’s single.

The Blazers built upon its lead with two runs in the fourth. Logan Petitt kicked things off with a single, bringing home Bane.

It didn’t take long for the Blazers to add to their lead as they scored seven more runs in the sixth. Trail scored on an RBI single by Parker, a two-run single by Hunter Michael, a two-run error, and two one-run errors.

The Blazers will be back in action tomorrow at home against Miami East at 5. The JV team will be traveling to Miami East also with a 5 PM start time.

Game Recap

Trail played errorless defensive to get the second win against Randolph Southern.

Elizabeth Glander and Payten Laird teamed up on the mound for the shut out with Alexus Acton behind the plate. Together they allowed only 4 hits. Glander struck out 2 allowing 2 hits. Laird struck out 4 and allowed 2 hits.

The blazers were hot at the plate the second game. Alexus Acton batted 1.000 going 3-3 with 4 RBIs. Ariel Lee went 2-2 with a double. Aleah Hunt and Hannah Dixon both went 2-3. Kylee Aldridge hit a gap shot triple, Kaitlyn Morgan added a double, and Gracie Jones had a base hit.

The blazers improve their record to 8-4 overall and 3-3 in the CCC. They will host Dayton Christian on Monday.

Game Recap

In game number two of the Saturday afternoon doubleheader, Chip Parker did his best to will National Trail to a win with a two-hit performance, but the Blazers dropped the contest 11-5 to Valley View.

Two of National Trail’s runs were scored thanks to timely hitting by Parker. He singled in the third inning and doubled in the fifth inning.

Wood got it done on the mound for the Spartans, earning the win. He allowed four runs over five innings. He struck out four, walked five and surrendered six hits.

Erbaugh, Ebersole and Myers helped lead Valley View. They combined for five hits and five RBIs.

Hunter Lee took the loss for the Blazers. He allowed eight runs in one inning, walked two and struck out none.

Valley View never trailed after scoring seven runs in the first on an error, two singles, and a three-run triple by Erbaugh.

One run in the bottom of the second helped National Trail close its deficit to 8-3. A sacrifice fly fly by Billy Lanman gave the Blazers life. Wood ended the inning by getting Michael Bane to strike out.

One run in the bottom of the fifth again helped narrow the gap to 9-4. An RBI double by Parker brought the run in. The National Trail threat came to an end when Wood finally got Hunter Lindsey to fly out.

After pushing across one run in the bottom of the seventh, the Blazers still faced a 11-5 deficit. Finally, Napier got Travis Hunt to fly out to end the game.
